The '''Gliding Water''' was the name of a river passing through [[Kortirion]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Kor">{{LT1|Kortirion1}}, p. 33</ref> It is only mentioned in an early version of the poem ''[[The Trees of Kortirion]]''.

According to the poem, [[elms]] grew about it, and it flowed westward from Kortirion, passing through meadows before reaching the sea.<ref name="Kor"/>

== Inspiration ==
The Gliding Water might have been inspired by the river [[wikipedia:River Avon, Warwickshire|Avon]], which flows through the town of [[wikipedia:Warwick|Warwick]], the main inspiration behind the city of Kortirion.<ref>[[John Garth]], ''[[The Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'', "Rivers, Lakes and Waterlands", p. 108</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In later reworkings of the poem, the river was called the '''''River Gliding''''' instead.<ref>{{LT1|Kortirion3}}, p. 40</ref>
